result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen L Young was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stephen L. Young in court with attorney Richard E. Bender. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ases heard this morning are 15CF-40 and 15CF-413.

9:09 AM Court calls cases.

There is a plea agreement.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

15CF-40: Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 3.  Counts 2, 4 and 5 to be dismissed and read in.

15CF-413: Defendant will plead to charge. 

Atty Knaapen states plea agreement.
Atty Bender concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF-40: Count 1: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-40: Count 3: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-413: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Bender for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-40: Count 1: Court finds Defendant Guilty
15CF-40: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-40: Count 3: Court finds Defendant Guilty
15CF-40: Count 4: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-40: Count 5: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-413: Court finds Defendant Guilty

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Bender makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF-40:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
AODA and comply with any recommendations with respect to treatment
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Obtain and maintain full time employment during period of probation
Submit DNA sample
Write short letter of apology to N.G., apologizing for the behavior
Write short letter of apology to arresting officer, apologizing for the behavior
Comply with any recommendations as stated by agent
Pay DNA surcharge
Pay costs

15CF-40:
Count 3:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period fo 24 Months, concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1
Pay costs

15CF-413:
Pay a fine of $300 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Cash bond of $850 may be applied to fine and costs

Court addresses voting rights and firearms rights and right to appeal. CR-243 form is to be filled out before the end of the day

Defendant Stephen L. Young in court with attorney Richard E. Bender. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:49 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

BY THE COURT: Bond continued. 

Atty Bender makes statements re: hearing in Wausau next week as well.

Defendant Stephen L. Young in court with attorney Richard E. Bender. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Arraignment scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Portage County Community Justice Program Court Referral Form

$850 cash bond: Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Comply with all other pending bond conditions.   Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  3 days a week and on scheduled court dates.

1:33 p.m.
DA #15PT2037
d.o.b. 04-09-1990
ADA Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jump.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant.
State requests a $850.00 cash bond with conditions as stated.
BTC: $850 cash bond: Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Comply with all other pending bond conditions.   Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  3 days a week and on scheduled court dates.
